algorithm_technique: BST traversal and comparison to find the smallest node greater than the target node.
problem_summary_simple: Find the next node in an in-order traversal of a BST.
problem_summary_technical: Leverage BST properties: if a node has a right child, its successor is the leftmost node in the right subtree; otherwise, it's an ancestor.
time_complexity: O(h), where h is the height of the BST.
key_insights: The in-order successor is either in the right subtree or an ancestor node.
If a node has a right child, the successor is the minimum value in its right subtree.
If no right child, traverse up the tree; the first ancestor whose left child is on the path to the node is the successor.
